intro: Heleogiton, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive golden hue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Heleogiton has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
